result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter S. Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Deft shall not reside in any place where minor children reside without the Court's permission.
ALL UNPAID COURT COSTS ARE STILL DUE.

4yrs 2mos WSP; initial confinement of 14mos followed by 3yrs of ES.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Cassi Baumgardner.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 4ys 2mos WSP; initial confinement of 14mos WSP followed by 3yrs of ES.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  In addition, the court includes a condition of "deft shall not reside in any place where minor children w/o court's permission."  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Credit for 62 days.  Appeal rights.  Voting warning.
Atty:  C Baumgarndner
revoc. summary

Screen 77 (CACU-I77C) w/copy of Revocation Order and Warrant; filed by Dept of Corr/Probation&Parole.   Defendant revoked on 1/15/16; to be returned to court for sentencing.  ZERO PAID ON PROBATION - ALL COSTS STILL DUE.  $518.00 court costs are still due.  kmk
of disposition of case; deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 4/17/15 @ 9am.

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Kristyne Watson. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 3-12-15 @ 10:00am. Jury selection on 4-20-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
Atty Kristyne Watson

Comply w/ Sex Offender registry requirements.
